data.text: Hear me your father, O children,
For the Lord hath given the father honor over the children,
Whoso honoreth his father maketh an atonement for his sins:
And he that honoreth his mother is as one that layeth up treasure.
Whoso honoreth his father shall have joy of his own children;
He that honoreth his father shall have a long life;
And will do service unto his parents, as to his masters.
Honor thy father and mother both in word and deed,
For the blessing of the father establisheth the houses of children;
Glory not in the dishonor of thy father;
For the glory of a man is from the honor of his father;
My son, help thy father in his age,
And if his understanding fail, have patience with him;
For the relieving of thy father shall not be forgotten:
In the day of thine affliction it shall be remembered;
He that forsaketh his father is as a blasphemer;
My son, go on with thy business in meekness;
The greater thou art, the more humble thyself,
For the power of the Lord is great,
Seek not out the things that are too hard for thee,
But what is commanded thee, think thereupon with reverence;
Be not curious in unnecessary matters;
For many are deceived by their own vain opinion;
A stubborn heart shall fare evil at the last;
An obstinate heart shall be laden with sorrows;
In the punishment of the proud there is no remedy;
The heart of the prudent will understand a parable;
Water will quench a flaming fire;
And he that requiteth good turns is mindful of that which may come hereafter;
